meanings.definition: To convert (organic matter) into a fossil.
meanings.sent1: The ancient bones were fossilized over millions of years.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaur bones fossilized in the sedimentary rock.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally fossilized my sandwich in the back of the fridge.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were fossilized in the pages of the old journal.
meanings.sent5: The tree's imprint fossilized in the volcanic ash.

meanings.definition: To become rigid or inflexible in one's habits or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: As he grew older, he fossilized in his ways and refused to try new things.
meanings.sent2: She fossilized in her opinions and wouldn't listen to different viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa fossilized in his routine of reading the newspaper every morning.
meanings.sent4: The company's outdated policies fossilized its ability to adapt to change.
meanings.sent5: Her fear of failure fossilized her from taking any risks in life.
